main.name: Andy Zhou
main.bio: Hi! I’m Andy — a CS undergraduate at CSU Long Beach. Equipped with skills in both front-end (React Framework) and back-end development (Node.js & Java), I offer a comprehensive suite of programming services. My computational thinking abilities allow me to confidently navigate complex coding and automation challenges. My experience spans front-end and back-end work across Ductra Creations LLC, RedApple Digital Health and Down. Always seeking new networking opportunities. Connect with me to discuss all things web development!

education.description: Courses: CECS 329 Algorithims, CECS 274 Data Structures, CECS 277 Java, CECS 451 Artificial Intelligence, CECS 456 Machine Learning, CECS 229 Discrete Mathematics, CECS 282 C++
A 12 week full-stack programming bootcamp that covered Javascript, React.js, C#, MySQL, AWS, and Azure

work.title: Backend Developer
work.description: - Developed automatically scaling Cloud functions for Firebase authentication that allowed users to register in a serverless approach
work.description2: - Created API endpoints for user interaction on the mobile application that increased user traffic by 15%

work.title: Full-Stack Engineer
work.description: - Maintained and managed auto-scaling groups, load balancers, and EC2 servers on AWS that led to a 26% decrease in CPU utilization
work.description2: - Created many different API endpoints for user and Database querying using Express and Node.js
work.description3: - Maintained a SDK for developing applications on multiple platforms
work.description4: - Developed dynamic and interactive front-end web pages using React
work.description5: - Maintained Mongo Atlas Database and connected it to AWS VPC to ensure network isolation and security

work.title: Web Developer Intern
work.description: - Utilized React to create web pages capable of dynamic programming
work.description2: - Helped maintain a SDK for developing applications on multiple different platforms
work.description3: - Implemented and maintained AWS EC2 servers for the development and production environment

work.title: Front-End Developer Intern
work.description: - Designed UI and implemented a web notification application for B2B interactions

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
